_header: To you my purse and to none other wight
Note:
Non-source-specific edition, Robinson (1933)
XRobinson, F. N. The Works of Geoffrey Chaucer. Oxford: Clarendon, 1933; 2nd ed. 1957, 635; 1957, 539-40.
_description: Chaucer’s ‘Complaynt to his Empty Purse’ — three stanzas rhyme royal and 5-line Envoy

BodFair16.First Lines:
To yow my purse and to noon other wightComplayn I for ye be my lady
                    dere…
BodFair16.Last Lines:
…And ye that mowen alle myn harme amendehaue mynde vppon my
                    supplicacioun
BodFair16.Attributed Author: The complaynt of Chaucer to his Purse (f. 193)
BodFair16.Attributed Title: The complaynt of Chaucer to his Purse (f. 193)

CULFf16.First Lines:
To yow my purs and to non othir wyghtComplayne I for ye bene my
                    lady dere…
CULFf16.Last Lines:
…And ye that mowen all oure harmes amendeHave mynd vpon my
                    supplicacioun

CamGon176.First Lines:
To you my purce and non other wyȝtComplayne I for you be my
                    lady dere…
CamGon176.Last Lines:
…Quene of comfort and of all companyBe hevy agayne or els most
                    I dye

             Modern Language Notes

             Papers of the Bibliographical Society of the University of

CamMagPep2006.First Lines:
To yow my purs and to non oþer wightCompleyn I for ye be my
                    lady dere…
CamMagPep2006.Last Lines:
…And ye <that> mow all all harmes amendHaue mynde
                    <vp>on my supplicacyon

BLAdd22139.First Lines:
To ȝou my purse and to non othre wightCompleyn I for to be my
                    Ladi dere…
BLAdd22139.Last Lines:
…But ȝit I pray vnto ȝoure curtesyeBe heuy agayn or
                    ellis I dye
BLAdd22139.Note: lacks the 5-line envoy; followed immediately by 5277.
BLAdd22139.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             A Parallel-Text Edition of Chaucer’s Minor Poems.
             3 vols. 
             Chaucer Society
         1st. ser. 21, 57, 58. London: Trübner, n.d. repr. New York and
            London: Johnson, 1967.

BLAdd34360.First Lines:
tO yow my purse and to nonother wightCompleyne I for þow my
                    lady deere…
BLAdd34360.Last Lines:
…ffor whiche vnto youre mercy I cryeBieth hevy ageyne or ellis
                    must I dye
BLAdd34360.Note:
Lacks Envoy and adds ‘Complaint of a Prisoner against
                    Fortune’ (1432)
                    as if part of same poem.
BLAdd34360.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             More Odd Texts.
Chaucer Society
         1st ser. 77. London: Trübner, 1886; repr. New York and London:
            Johnson, 1967.

Thomas’s transcript is British Museum Catalogue 643,

BLHar2251.First Lines:
TO yow my purse and to nonother wightCompleyne I for þow my
                    lady dere…
BLHar2251.Last Lines:
ffor whiche vnto yowre mercy I cryeBeth hevy ageyn or ellis must I
                    dye
BLHar2251.Note:
Lacks Envoy and adds ‘Complaint of a Prisoner against
                    Fortune’ (1432)
                    as if part of same poem.

BLHar7333.First Lines:
TO yowe my purs se & to noon oþer
                    wyghtCompleyne I ffor yee be my lady dere
BLHar7333.Last Lines:
But yitte I pray vn to youre courtesyeBeeþe heui A geyne or
                    elles mot I dyeLenvoyeO conquerowre of brutes
                    AlbyoneWhich þat by lyne and freo ellecciounBeon veray kynge
                    þis songe to yow I sendeAnd yee þat may all oure harmous
                    amendeHaþe mynde vppon my supplicacioun
BLHar7333.Attributed Title: A supplication to Kyng Richard by chaucier (f. 147vb)
BLHar7333.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             A Parallel-Text Edition of Chaucer’s Minor Poems.
             3 vols. 
             Chaucer Society
         1st. ser. 21, 57, 58. London: Trübner, n.d. repr. New York and
            London: Johnson, 1967.

CovAcc3251.First Lines:
To you my purs and to you none oþer wightCompleine I for
                    ȝe be my lady dere…
CovAcc3251.Last Lines:
…But yit I praie vn to your curtesieBeth hevie ayenne or els I
                    mot die
CovAcc3251.Note: Only three stanzas; does not include envoy.

PierpontM4.First Lines:
To yow my purse and to none oþer wightCompleyne y for ye be my
                    lady dere…
PierpontM4.Last Lines:
…ffor whiche vn to you mercy thus y CryeBethe hevy ayen or ell
                    y must dye
PierpontM4.Note: Only three stanzas; does not include envoy.
